main_definition: Muslims refer to the followers of Islam, a monotheistic religion based on the teachings of the Prophet Muhammad as communicated in the Quran.

meanings_and_examples.example: Muslims around the world celebrate Eid al-Fitr, a festival marking the end of Ramadan.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Individuals who follow the five pillars of Islam
meanings_and_examples.example: As Muslims, they are required to pray five times daily and fast during the month of Ramadan.

meanings_and_examples.definition: People who adhere to the teachings and principles outlined in the Quran and Hadith
meanings_and_examples.example: Muslim scholars interpret the Quran and provide guidance on Islamic law (Sharia) based on their understanding of these texts.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A collective term for people from diverse backgrounds, nationalities, ethnicities, and cultures who share a common faith in Islam
meanings_and_examples.example: Muslims come from all corners of the globe, including countries like Indonesia, Turkey, Pakistan, Egypt, Saudi Arabia, and many others.
